lexUnit.name: survey.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: look carefully and thoroughly at.

sentence.text: We 'll be happy to survey your home to ensure that you can pick up the necessary signals … and that you really will be able to enjoy perfect Satellite Television reception .
Geologists had been active in surveying the land to reveal new mineral deposits , but had occasionally warned that the supply was not infinite and would eventually become exhausted .
In 1912-14 the statistician A. L. Bowley and his colleagues surveyed five representative English towns to establish whether Rowntree 's findings in York were more widely applicable .
His eyes surveyed her for a moment .
The blue eyes surveyed her face for a moment , their expression dark and oddly unreadable .
Hatch straightened up from the plant box , and surveyed his handiwork for a second before looking at Cowley and saying , ` Maiden Lane or Memory Lane ?
The satellite makes 14 orbits per day , and at present IRAS surveys the sky for nine orbits and uses DAX for five .
Butch tattooed women survey the hedges for Peeping Toms .
Shaun Campbell surveys the back of the grid for grand prix racing 's biggest failures .
What had happened to the icy indifference with which she had surveyed the world for the past few years ?
Garland surveyed literature for the running speeds of 107 diverse mammal species and discovered that the maximal speed tends to increase gradually with increasing body mass .
He surveyed the spots in silence , whilst the patient awaited the worst .
As she spoke , she surveyed the result in the mirror .
The hooded eyes surveyed her with frank appreciation mingled with amusement .
He surveyed them with loathing .
She said nothing , surveying the landscape with cool hauteur .
Tawno Smith surveyed the new decor with only a partial satisfaction .
Unpleasant and smelly as the operation was , she felt a surge of exultation when she cut the thread of the last suture and surveyed her unconscious patient .
Erm they 're obtained by looking at the results of the labour force survey which is a very small proportion of households surveyed each year .
Berwickshire was surveyed by John Blackadder and Ainslie only engraved it in 1797 .
The location is thoroughly surveyed by Marketing and Engineering staff .
Head teachers and other teachers were surveyed and asked to describe their preparation for , execution of , and follow-up after topic work .
Language teaching in 2000 schools was surveyed : there was widespread commitment to basic skills , and much emphasis on formal practice .
We 've exhaustively surveyed Leeds time and again to find these erm so called brown field sites which our own residents suggest are there .

President Bush visited Los Angeles on May 7-8 to survey the scene of the rioting and used the occasion to announce a $19,000,000 anti-drug and anti-gang programme for the worst-affected areas of the city .
American research has been instructive and I survey this before moving to my own views .
Eight in 10 women surveyed said that they would use ` natural " remedies and considered pharmacists as effective as doctors in treating minor ills .
